title: Leaves from the journal of our life in the Highlands, from 1848 to 1861 :
author: Victoria
snippet: It reminded me and Louis ofClova; only there one did not see the immenseextent of mountains behind.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: It is situated in the centre of a region of deer forests, comprehending  those of ilar (Earl of Fife), which stretches up Ben-muich- dhui; Balloch-bowie (Farquharson of Invercauld), which extends from Falls of the Garrawalt away by Lochnagar and Clova.

title: St. Paul's to St. Sophia;
author: McCormick, Richard C.
snippet: " No sermon at Cortachy this day, the minister being at Clova, at the trial 01 a witch."

title: Tales of a Grandfather ... [ser. 1-3.] With notes.
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: But he found only a few Highlandersat Clova, without the appearance of .an army, which he had promised himself,and was easily induced to return to the camp with a party who had been dispatched in pursuit of him.
